title: Principal Developer, Machine Learning Compute Services, Google Cloud
description: As the Principal Developer, you will be responsible for driving the Google Cloud Machine Learning Compute Services technical strategy, enabling highly scalable ML services powered by both GPUs and TPUs. You'll provide technical leadership in this critical emerging AI/ML cloud use-case.
key_qualifications: 15 years of experience in software development, or 10 years with an advanced degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or Engineering. Experience in hardware and software design, data structures and algorithms, debugging, and with customer-facing products.
preferred_qualifications: Master's degree in a relevant field. Ability to work cross-functionally, partnering with groups such as Sales, Developing, Product Management, Product Marketing, UX, and UI, brokering trade offs with stakeholders and understanding their needs. Outstanding narrative and storytelling skills that propel usage, adoption, and market momentum.
responsibilities: Develop a strategic vision for the Google Cloud Platform organization to constantly innovate and implement novel solutions for next-generation ML and HPC infrastructure services. Design, build, and deploy solutions that leverage GPU, TPU, and highly-scalable hardware and software infrastructure to deliver compelling solutions for GPU, TPU, ML, and HPC workloads. Manage robust and scalable systems to get ahead of the exponential market demand. Manage exceptional scheduling and resource management initiatives to optimize GCP service offerings for batch workloads for the key technical computing and machine learning use-cases. Influence and establish developing best practices through solid design decisions, processes, and tools.
